comments.body: Yeah, the category thing was a mistake.  I've been moving everything over to the shell category with the intent of killing categories whenever we change buckets.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +124,128 @@      name: 'Flutter for Mojo',
      fileName: 'flutter.mojo',
      category: _kShellCategory,
      type: ArtifactType.mojo,
      targetPlatform: TargetPlatform.android

comments.body: Not 100% sure it would work, but you could try a mechanical translation of the enum name ==> a string.  Perhaps a bit easier than maintaining both the enums and this switch statement?

Given all the different special symbols that can appear in a name that's hard to do unfortunately :(

Luckily, the analyzer will complain if you add something to the enum, but forget to add it to this switch.

We'd want to make sure that this results in a tool crash with a crash report. Could you please check that that's what happens?

Also, do we expect that this line should never be reached? If so, we should throw a longer message saying that this is likely a bug in Flutter and invite the user to file an issue. [Here's an example](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/60f5ae8e77ecfd479333ce68a8fd81b0778132f1/packages/flutter/lib/src/foundation/assertions.dart#L277).

Yes - this is an exception that generates a "Flutter crash report" log.

This function runs when you are building a debug mode JIT snapshot with a locally built engine.  If it throws, it means that something is wrong with your local engine build output.  It may or may not be a bug in flutter_tools or in the engine build process.
